Reactions.title: The Reactions Description Box.
examples:
+2 from 'Charisma 2'
Conditional:
-2 from 'Reputation 2 (Gang Leader; 7 or less, +1, *1/3; Large class, +1, *1/2)'

Appearance.title: The character points spent on appearance.

GeneralAppearance.title: The character's General Appearance.
examples: Short mohawk, painted face, likes to wear chains, like something out of Road Warrior.

EnhancedGroundMovePoints.title: The Enhanced Ground Move Character Points.

FlightChecked.title: Does the character have the Flight advantage?

FlightPoints.title: The character points spent on Flight.

BasicAirMovePoints.title: The Basic Air Move Character Points.

EnhancedAirMovePoints.title: The Enhanced Air Move Character Points.

BasicWaterMovePoints.title: The Basic Water Move Character Points.

EnhancedWaterMovePoints.title: The Enhanced Water Move Character Points.

SpellBonus.title: The Spell Bonus. Typically pick the highest of Magery, Power Investiture.

CombatReflexes.title: Does the character have Combat Reflexes?

Idkey.title: The Idkey is the unique identifier, allowing the item to be easily re-imported.

Spoken.title: The Amount of Points entered for the Spoken trait of the language.

Written.title: The Amount of Points entered for the The Written trait of the language.

Idkey.title: The Idkey is the unique identifier, allowing the item to be easily re-imported.

Points.title: The Amount of Points entered for the Culture trait.

Idkey.title: The Idkey is the unique identifier, allowing the item to be easily re-imported.

Foa.title: The Frequency of Appearance check as a single number.

Points.title: The Amount of Points entered for the trait.

Ref.title: The Book and Page Reference for the trait.

Notes.title: Notes about the trait

examples.Name: Extra ST
examples.Notes:
Affects ST, +0%
Size, +0%
The Extra ST advantage allows you to take extra levels of the attribute which you can then apply enhancements and limitations to. The "Affects displayed score" modifier causes the Extra ST advantage to affect the displayed attribute score. If you don't wish this advantage to affect the displayed score remove that modifier.

examples: Torso armor isn't interchangeable with human torso armor.

Points.title: The Amount of Points entered for the racial trait.

Ref.title: The Book and Page Reference for a racial trait.

Idkey.title: The Idkey is the unique identifier, allowing the item to be easily re-imported.

Tl.title: The Tech Level of the Skill.

Base.title: The Base Attribute of the Skill, see examples for available options.

Difficulty.title: The Difficulty Level of the Skill, see examples for available options.

Bonus.title: The Skill Modifier to apply to the skill, such as +1 from a talent.

Points.title: The Amount of Points entered for the skill.

Skill.title: The Final Skill level of the skill. NOTE: this is used by the importer to check for modifiers that may need to get applied.

Ref.title: The Book and Page Reference for a skill.

SkillModNotes.title: The Skill Modifier Notes for the skill.

Notes.title: The Notes Schema
examples: Notes: Calculated damage takes into account bonuses from Teeth, Weak Bite, Claws, and skill level. You may add the modifier "Has Gauntlets/Brass Knuckles" or "Has Boots" to apply the +1 damage to Punch or Kick, as appropriate.

examples.Name: Brawling
examples.Notes: Notes: Calculated damage takes into account bonuses from Teeth, Weak Bite, Claws, and skill level. You may add the modifier "Has Gauntlets/Brass Knuckles" or "Has Boots" to apply the +1 damage to Punch or Kick, as appropriate.

examples.Name: Brawling
examples.Notes: Notes: Calculated damage takes into account bonuses from Teeth, Weak Bite, Claws, and skill level. You may add the modifier "Has Gauntlets/Brass Knuckles" or "Has Boots" to apply the +1 damage to Punch or Kick, as appropriate.

Idkey.title: The Idkey is the unique identifier, allowing the item to be easily re-imported.

Parent.title: The name of the Parent Skill of the Technique.

BaseLevel.title: The Base Skill Level of the Technique, usually the same as the Parent Skill.

Default.title: The Default Modifier of the Technique. Kicking is Brawaling-2, so the default modifier is -2.

MaxModifier.title: The Maximum Modifier that can be applied to a technique.

Difficulty.title: The Difficulty Level of the Technique, see examples for available options.

SkillModifier.title: The Skill Modifier to apply to the Technique, such as +1 from a talent.

Points.title: The Amount of Points entered for the Technique

Skill.title: The Skill Level of the Technique. NOTE: This will be used by the importer to verify the effective skill and adjust the modifier as needed.

Ref.title: The Book and Page Reference of the technique.

SkillModNotes.title: The Skill Modifier Notes for the technique.

Idkey.title: The Idkey is the unique identifier, allowing the item to be easily re-imported.

Name.title: The Name of the Active Defense

Type.title: The Type of Defense, see examples for available options.

Info.title: The Info field is used by the roll template. F = Fencing, U = Unbalanced. See examples.

Skill.title: The Skill Level of the Active Defense.

SkillMod.title: The Skill Modifier, such as +1 from a Talent.

Idkey.title: The Idkey is the unique identifier, allowing the item to be easily re-imported.

Name.title: The Name of the Melee Attack.

Damage.title: The Damage Roll. If damage starts with ~, the importer will use a macro to allow user's to select the number of dice to roll.

Type.title: The Damage Type, see examples for available options.

Reach.title: The Reach of the melee attack.

Skill.title: The Skill Level of the melee attack.

ArmorDivisor.title: The Armor Divisor to apply to melee attack.

Notes.title: The Notes on the melee attack.
examples: {Brawling (p. B182) increases all unarmed damage; Claws (p. B42) and Karate (p. B203) improve damage with punches and kicks (Claws don't affect damage with brass knuckles or boots); and Boxing (p. B182) improves punching damage.}
{If you miss with a kick, roll vs. DX to avoid falling.}
{Worn on the wrist, leaving the hand free.}

examples.Name: Bite
examples.Notes: {Brawling (p. B182) increases all unarmed damage; Claws (p. B42) and Karate (p. B203) improve damage with punches and kicks (Claws don't affect damage with brass knuckles or boots); and Boxing (p. B182) improves punching damage.}

Idkey.title: The Idkey is the unique identifier, allowing the item to be easily re-imported.

Name.title: The Name of the Ranged Attack.

Damage.title: The Damage Die. If damage starts with ~, the importer will use a macro to allow user's to select the number of dice to roll.

Type.title: The Damage Type, see examples for available options.

Acc.title: The Accuracy of the ranged attack.

Rof.title: The Rate of Fire of the attack.

Shots.title: The Shots (reload time) of the attack.

Bulk.title: The Bulk rating of the attack.

Skill.title: The Skill Level of the attack.

Malfunction.title: The Malfunction value of the attack.

ArmorDivisor.title: The Armor Divisor of the attack.

Idkey.title: The Idkey is the unique identifier, allowing the item to be easily re-imported.

Tl.title: The Tech Level of the item.

Ref.title: The book and page Reference of the item.

Cost.title: The individual cost of each item.

Notes.title: The Notes on the item.
examples:
Signature Gear, +0
TL:8 LC:2 DR:35/5* Location:torso Notes:[1] Concealable as or under clothing. [5] Use the lower DR versus crushing attacks only.

TL:6 LC:4 DR:6/2 Location:feet Notes:[1] Concealable as or under clothing. [2] Give +1 to kicking damage (p. B271). [4] Split DR: use the first, higher DR when - in the GM's opinion - the boot's steel toe box would protect (e. g. , dropping an item on the foot or crushing the toes in heavy machinery) or when an attack on the foot hits the toe (2/6 protection); use the second, lower DR against all other attacks.

TL:^ LC:3 DB:3 Dam:thr cr Reach:1 Parry:No ST:-- DR:100 HP:-- Skill:Shield (Force) Notes: [3,5] Also available as a buckler. You can ready a buckler in one turn and drop it as a free action, just like a weapon - but it always occupies one hand, and it does not allow a shield rush. Use Shield (Buckler) instead of regular shield skill. No effect on statistics. Worn on the wrist, leaving the hand free. DR is hardened (treat as Hardened enhancement, p. B47).
TL:8 Notes: +1 to skill, see Laser Sights (p. B412)
TL:0 Notes: Minimum gear for camping: -2 to any Survival roll without it. Includes utensils, tinderbox or flint and steel, towel, etc., as TL permits.

Rugged, *2
Receives Skill Bonus, +1, +0
TL:7 LC:3 Damage:3d-1 pi Acc:2 Range:185/2000 RoF:3 Shots:6(3i) ST:10 Bulk:-2 Rcl:3 Skill:Guns (Pistol)

examples.Name: Advanced Body Armor
examples.Notes:
Signature Gear, +0
TL:8 LC:2 DR:35/5* Location:torso Notes:[1] Concealable as or under clothing. [5] Use the lower DR versus crushing attacks only.

examples.Name: Boots, Steel-Toed
examples.Notes: TL:6 LC:4 DR:6/2 Location:feet Notes:[1] Concealable as or under clothing. [2] Give +1 to kicking damage (p. B271). [4] Split DR: use the first, higher DR when - in the GM's opinion - the boot's steel toe box would protect (e. g. , dropping an item on the foot or crushing the toes in heavy machinery) or when an attack on the foot hits the toe (2/6 protection); use the second, lower DR against all other attacks.

examples.Name: Force Shield
examples.Notes: TL:^ LC:3 DB:3 Dam:thr cr Reach:1 Parry:No ST:-- DR:100 HP:-- Skill:Shield (Force) Notes: [3,5] Also available as a buckler. You can ready a buckler in one turn and drop it as a free action, just like a weapon - but it always occupies one hand, and it does not allow a shield rush. Use Shield (Buckler) instead of regular shield skill. No effect on statistics. Worn on the wrist, leaving the hand free. DR is hardened (treat as Hardened enhancement, p. B47).

examples.Name: Laser Sight
examples.Notes: TL:8 Notes: +1 to skill, see Laser Sights (p. B412)

examples.Name: Personal Basics
examples.Notes: TL:0 Notes: Minimum gear for camping: -2 to any Survival roll without it. Includes utensils, tinderbox or flint and steel, towel, etc., as TL permits.

examples.Name: Revolver, .357M
examples.Notes:
Rugged, *2
Receives Skill Bonus, +1, +0

Idkey.title: The Idkey is the unique identifier, allowing the item to be easily re-imported.

Difficulty.title: The Difficulty Level of the spell, see examples for available options. T/H is Technique hard.

SpellModifier.title: The Spell Modifier to apply to the spell, such as +1 from a talent.

Points.title: The Amount of Points entered for the spell.

Cost.title: FP Cost notes of the spell.

Skill.title: The Final Skill level of the spell. NOTE: this is used by the importer to check for modifiers that may need to get applied.

Ref.title: The Book and Page Reference for a spell.

Casttime.title: The casting time for a spell.

Maintain.title: The maintenance cost for a spell. Note: GCA5 doesn't have a separate maintenance cost field.

SpellModNotes.title: The Spell Modifier Notes for the spell.

RepeatingItem.Name: Force Shield
RepeatingItem.Notes: TL:^ LC:3 DB:3 Dam:thr cr Reach:1 Parry:No ST:-- DR:100 HP:-- Skill:Shield (Force) Notes: [3,5] Also available as a buckler. You can ready a buckler in one turn and drop it as a free action, just like a weapon - but it always occupies one hand, and it does not allow a shield rush. Use Shield (Buckler) instead of regular shield skill. No effect on statistics. Worn on the wrist, leaving the hand free. DR is hardened (treat as Hardened enhancement, p. B47).

RepeatingItem.Notes: TL:0 Notes: Minimum gear for camping: -2 to any Survival roll without it. Includes utensils, tinderbox or flint and steel, towel, etc., as TL permits.
